selected_quotes: Strong statement by @Jeffrey_Beall in @Nature: Predatory journals: Ban predators from the scientific record
Predatory journals are threatening the credibility of science. #sciencetwitter
#OA advocates must stop pretending that the author-pays model is free of serious, long-term structural problems
Should predatory journals be banned? Pseudoscientist Anatole Klyosov (Advances in Anthropology) thinks not
Predatory journals: Ban predators from the scientific record #RBUS6914 #Phdlife

citation.title: Predatory journals: Ban predators from the scientific record

peer_reviews.summary: "I am not Unreg or Peer 3" -- sorry, but I cannot be sure about that. But makes no objective difference, since I'll not participate in this debate about Beall's lists, though I do agree with the general criticism against them...
Peer 1, it is good that there is no potential for confusion now. There is, of course, even less potential for confusion at PubMed Commons as anonymity is not allowed...
This is exactly why PubPeer needs unique numerical userID's, registered to the email address of corresponding authors, and no unregistered posts...
Peer 6, your criticisms of Mr. Beall are spot on.
Any body knows why Hindawi was removed from the list? Who, besides Mr. Beall, reviews the list?
Mr. Beall is certainly free to express his opinions. You can agree or disagree.Not all his arguments make a lot of sense to me. Email is not hopelessly flawed because there is spam (http://www...

I am not sure I understand you, Peer 4. Do you think that Unreg, Peer 1 and Peer 3 are all the same identity? Why do you think so? This is a very interesting discussion and I felt it was necessary to address the harsh criticism of Beall by Peer 1.
I agree that it would be preferable to include a list of criteria explaining more in details why the journals are listed as predator journals, and I hope Jeff will include that...
What is really dangerous is the junk science published by the numerous predator journals. They should at least be blocked by PubMed and other major sites.
More unspecific trash talk by Jeffrey Beall based on flawed lists and porous parameters. These recommendations are dangerous and discriminatory...

Unreg, are you suggesting that:a) all of the journals and publishers on those lists are valid?b) the methods and criteria used to include those journals and publishers are based on quantifiable criteria?c) journals and publishers not on Beall's lists are n
Could you explain us why do you think that Beall's list is flawed and the parameters are porous. The predatory journals are a really toxic, isn't it?
Peer 3, let Beall show the precise criteria for EACH journal and EACH publisher, then I fully agree with you, let the data-bases like Thomson Reuters, PubMed, Scopus, DOAJ, OASPA, etc...

I agree with the general terms of this discussion but will not participate for I doubt the goals of Peer 1. For instance, I feel Unregistered Submission: ( June 15th, 2016 7:57pm UTC ) and Peer 3 are in the end all same Peer 1.

Please do not try to undermine the important job Beall has been doingby organizing a list of all the junk journals. Regarding Pubpeer: there are no systems that are perfect, one would always find reasons to critisism, and there are always people with diffe

Just for the official record, Peer 4 and Peer 5, I am not Unreg or Peer 3. However, what the lack of moderation by PubPeer of your comments represents is a dangerous platform that allows "Peers" with an agenda to make unsupported and unproven claims, in es
Peer 3 and Peer 7, kindly stop deviating from the topic at hand. Please focus on the paper that was published by Beall, and what he has invoked in that paper...

Beall has done a great service to the community and is commended for continuing his work in the face of brutal, often unhinged criticism (see above) from those for whom his findings hit rather too close to home...

Peer 4, the public release of the peer reviewer reports and the names of the editors and peer reviewers who approved this paper would be the only way to resolve "how Beall's paper got accepted in Nature"...

"I am firmly opposed to this article's publication".It's an opinion piece.  Get over yourself.For instance, I've seen a huge amount of what I consider to be trash published by one self-righteous "publishing ethics" crusader...

"because Beall was able to publish his opinion in Nature" -- I am not sure about that, though it might play a part. As I mention before, I think Peer 1 has psychological goals other than actually discussing the ideas she/he puts down, and that is why I wis
For what it's worth, I'm not Beall.
"Get over yourself." Almost always sound advice.NPG and traditional librarians like Beall should also take that advice...

Is your argument really going to be that Beall should be taking on "Predatory Post Offices"?I will take this as an admission that you barely read Beall's 2012 article or did not understand it if you did...
"I'll let you figure out the reason that they lie about being located somewhere where they are not. I'm sure it has absolutely nothing to do with feigning credibility to make money...
No.What the 2012 article *actually* says is that many predatory journals based in India, etc. *pretend* to be from the US or the UK...

I would argue that Beall letters have not been very well vetted by NPG. The 2012 piece argued in effect that India, Pakistan and Nigeria have no business competing in scientific publishing and that only the Brits and Americans are worthy...
Good question. Do you get an ""Author's response" when you comment or respond to queries on your own articles? If not, think about the reasons that could cause that...

Is one of the "Peers" above Jeffrey Beall? If yes, then why has PubPeer not labeled it as an "Author's response". If not, then why will Beall not come to PubPeer to explain in public why his lists have no detailed criteria listed publicly for each and ever
I stand behind my criticism Peer 8 - that sentence reeks.

And neither am I. As evidenced by the publication of Beall's Nature letter and substantial scientific and media coverage not initiated by Beall, there is broad positive recognition of his work and its importance, which a small number of vocal detractors se

So, in essence, you agree that Beall does not own copyright on journal and publisher quality, and that anyone with an opinion is entitled to it, even if a minority, and even if that opinion contradicts Beall's standing...
If Mr Beall was only after the predators it would be one thing and he might win my support.His agenda flogged by Nature is against all open access - authors pays scientific publishing...

news.title: Predatory journals: Ban predators from the scientific record
news.summary: Predatory journals are threatening the credibility of science. By faking or neglecting peer review, they pollute the scholarly record with fringe or junk science and activist research.
